name: Gray Leaf Spot
about: Gray Leaf Spot is a fungal disease that primarily affects maize leaves, reducing photosynthesis and yield.
symptoms: Creates rectangular gray lesions on maize leaves, starting as small, light brown spots that enlarge.
treatment: Apply fungicides containing strobilurins or triazoles. Rotate crops to reduce pathogen survival.
prevention: Use resistant maize hybrids. Avoid dense planting to improve airflow and reduce moisture.
cause: Caused by the fungus Cercospora zeae-maydis, thrives in warm, humid conditions.

name: Common Rust
about: Common Rust is a fungal disease of maize that appears as rust-colored pustules on leaves, reducing plant vigor.
symptoms: Reddish-brown pustules appear on both sides of maize leaves, later turning black.
treatment: Apply fungicides such as azoxystrobin or propiconazole if infection is severe. Use resistant maize varieties.
prevention: Plant early-maturing maize hybrids. Ensure proper field sanitation by removing crop debris.
cause: Caused by the fungus Puccinia sorghi, spreads through airborne spores in humid conditions.

name: Corn Leaf Blight
about: Corn Leaf Blight is a fungal infection that causes large lesions on maize leaves, affecting plant health and yield.
symptoms: Elongated, tan-colored lesions with dark brown borders, spreading across leaves.
treatment: Apply fungicides like mancozeb or copper-based treatments. Use crop rotation with non-host plants.
prevention: Use disease-resistant maize varieties. Maintain good field drainage to avoid excess moisture.
cause: Caused by Exserohilum turcicum (Northern Corn Leaf Blight) or Cochliobolus heterostrophus (Southern Corn Leaf Blight).

name: Healthy Leaf
about: A healthy maize leaf is free from disease symptoms, ensuring maximum photosynthesis and plant productivity.
symptoms: Bright green leaves with no visible spots, lesions, or discoloration.
treatment: No treatment required. Maintain optimal soil nutrients and proper irrigation.
prevention: Ensure balanced fertilization, good field hygiene, and proper spacing for airflow.
cause: Healthy growth conditions with no disease infection.
